remarks: The property of being a proper line, generated by two distinct points.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-May-2019.)
statement:
tglineelsb2.p $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tgelrnln.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
tgelrnln.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
tgelrnln.d $e |- ( ph -> X =/= Y ) $.
tgelrnln $p |- ( ph -> ( X L Y ) e. ran L ) $.
